DISCLAIMER: The creator of this app is not a registered psychologist in any way, shape, or form. The results you obtain from these questionnaires do not serve as diagnoses to personality disorders, rather they're intentions are to depict the likelihood one may need to seek help from professionals. 

Anti-social personality disorder (ASPD) is characterized by rash, impulsive, irresponsible and negligent behaviour. A person with ASPD can be manipulative, deceitful, reckless, and lack empathy. Psychopaths and sociopaths tend to fall into this category. 

Narcissistic personality disorder (NPD) is a mental health condition characterized by having excessive grandiosity and vanity of oneself. People with NPD seek excessive validation and admiration from their peers. Often mistaken for psychopaths due to their ego-centrism. People with NPD can be manipulative and often become extremely hostile when upset, due to their deep-seeded insecurities and low self-esteem. 

Borderline personality disorder (BPD) is characterized by having an intense fear of abandonment, and difficulty tolerating being alone. Severely impacting one's ability to manage their emotions, a person with BPD tends to be rash and impulsive. Usually, during times of great distress, a person with BPD may partake in reckless and dangerous behaviors like binge-eating, reckless driving, casual sex, and substance abuse.

Histrionic personality disorder (HPD) or commonly known as a dramatic personality disorder, is a psychiatric disorder distinguished by a pattern of exaggerated emotionality and attention-seeking behaviors. Ones with HPD are typically flirtatious, seductive, charming, manipulative, impulsive, and lively.
